title: Stephen Pedley
text:
Geoffrey Stephen Pedley (known as Stephen; born 13 September 1940) was the <a href="Anglican%20Bishop%20of%20Lancaster">Bishop suffragan of Lancaster</a> from 1998 until 2005.
He was educated at <a href="Marlborough%20College">Marlborough</a> and <a href="Queens%27%20College%2C%20Cambridge">Queens' College, Cambridge</a>. <a href="Ordained">Ordained</a> in 1966 after a period of study at <a href="Ripon%20College%20Cuddesdon">Ripon College Cuddesdon</a> he began his career with <a href="Curate">curacies</a> in <a href="Anglican%20Diocese%20of%20Liverpool">Liverpool</a> and <a href="Diocese%20of%20Coventry">Coventry</a> before a spell in <a href="Zambia">Zambia</a>. Returning to <a href="England">England</a> in 1977 he became Vicar of <a href="St%20Peter%27s%2C%20Stockton-on-Tees">St Peter's, Stockton-on-Tees</a> and then <a href="Whickham">Whickham</a> before becoming a <a href="Canon%20%28priest%29">Residentiary Canon</a> at <a href="Durham%20Cathedral">Durham Cathedral</a>, a post he held until his elevation to the <a href="Episcopal%20See">Episcopate</a>.
